column4: during the install process for 10.10 on my aspire one d250, the internet worked fine via wireless wpa2. now that it is installed, it attempts to connect and then prompts me for a key again - it will not connect.
(atheros chipset, too..)
which atheros chipset?
fantastic question, i'll do an lspci
i red another post (from dec 31) that described a similar problem, and they suggested madwifi
but it worked before installation
leads me to believe perhaps an upgraded package broke it
hmm.. i really don't know...
i learned with SuSE (long before ubuntu existed) myself, but i'd think linux mint is a bit easier to nubs than ubuntu itself
depending on whether you're using it as your daily system
while learning
i'm not a huge fan of Mint, but i really fail to see hiow it's any easier than Ubuntu... it's more or less the same thing, just a different GUI.

no it includes a multitude of applications and packages for various tasks, including non-free, to make the transition a bit easier from windows to linux for daily use without knowing how to rectify things yourself
ex. official ATI/NVIDIA drivers and flash are at your fingertips, etc.
i dunno, flash takes 30sec to install on ubuntu, and Nvidia drivers... i just use the restricted driver, and its no problem.
if you're technical already it's not a big difference, but if you're a total noob, it can help
someone like me, and from what i understand you, wouldnt take much effort to adjust
but someone who can barely install crap on windows might find it much easier
right
for the record, after hooking up wired ethernet and doing a software update it fixed my wifi connecting problem - just in case you run into that with someone else
im out of here now, bai
